answers.answer: Could be migraines, the colorful dots are typical of one kind of migraine and I have also heard that some people with epilepsy see them.  But you really need a better workup, not just for anemia and diabetes.  Have you been put into a Holter heart monitor to see how your heart is working?  See a good doctor.

question: i black out all the time. sometimes like 2 or 3 times a day, sometimes up to around 8 times a day. when i black out i see colorfull dots everywhere, then my vision caves in and i cant see, i get dizzy and my body tingles from my head to me toes and i also hear ringing in my ears. then after about 8 seconds it fades back. this has been happening since elementary school basicly as far back as i remember. i once fainted in kindergarten and a couple years ago i was playing volleyball and lost all control in my legs and fell over and my eyes rolled behind my head. and i fainted another time last year at my friend's house. i have regular blood pressure and i have been checked for anemia and diabetes. idk whats wrong with  mee :(
title: i need helpp
